defaultGhost.text: transparent background, shows a fill on hover; suitable for low-priority actions

primary.label: primary:
primary.text: emphasis button using the same CSS variables as text buttons; suitable for high-priority actions

disabled.label: disabled:
disabled.text: use the disabled attribute; opacity is reduced to 0.5

theme.label: theme support:
theme.text: the primary variant supports theming via CSS variables

markdownPreview.title: Markdown Preview
markdownPreview.sample:
# Markdown Component Full Preview

Welcome to the BitFun Markdown component preview page!

## Basic Syntax

### Text Styles

This is **bold text**, this is *italic text*, and this is ~~strikethrough~~.

You can also combine styles, like ***bold italic***.

### Lists

#### Unordered list

- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Subitem 2.1
  - Subitem 2.2
- Item 3

#### Ordered list

1. Step one
2. Step two
3. Step three

#### Task list

- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Pending task
- [ ] Another task

## Code Examples

### Inline code

Run `npm install` to install dependencies, then run `npm run dev` to start the dev server.

### Code blocks

```typescript
interface User {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  email: string;
}

function greetUser(user: User): string {
  return `Hello, ${user.name}!`;
}

const user: User = {
  id: '1',
  name: 'Alice',
  email: 'alice@example.com'
};

console.log(greetUser(user));
```

```javascript
// JavaScript example
const fetchData = async () => {
  try {
    const response = await fetch('https://api.example.com/data');
    const data = await response.json();
    return data;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error:', error);
  }
};
```

```python
# Python example
def fibonacci(n):
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)

for i in range(10):
    print(f"F({i}) = {fibonacci(i)}")
```

## Tables

| Feature | Description | Supported |
|------|------|---------|
| Headings | H1-H6 headings | Yes |
| Lists | Ordered/unordered lists | Yes |
| Code blocks | Syntax highlighting | Yes |
| Tables | Markdown tables | Yes |
| Links | Hyperlinks | Yes |
| Images | Image rendering | Yes |
| Blockquotes | Blockquotes | Yes |

## Blockquotes

> This is a blockquote.
> 
> It can be used to emphasize important information or quote someone.
> 
> — BitFun Team

> **Note:** Blockquotes can include other Markdown elements, including **bold**, *italic*, and `code`.

## Links

Visit the [BitFun website](https://bitfun.dev) for more information.

See the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/bitfun) for the source code.

Auto link: https://example.com

## Images

![Sample image](https://via.placeholder.com/600x300/667eea/ffffff?text=BitFun+Markdown)

## Horizontal Rule

---

## Nested Content

### Code inside lists

1. First install dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install react-markdown
   ```

2. Then use it in code:
   ```jsx
   import ReactMarkdown from 'react-markdown';
   
   <ReactMarkdown>{content}</ReactMarkdown>
   ```

### List inside blockquote

> #### Notes
> 
> - Make sure to properly escape special characters
> - Use appropriate syntax highlighting
> - Keep the document structure clear

## Special Formats

<details>
<summary>Click to expand details</summary>

This content is collapsed; click the title to expand.

- Supports HTML tags
- Can include Markdown content

</details>

## Summary

The BitFun Markdown component supports:

1. Full Markdown syntax
2. GitHub Flavored Markdown (GFM)
3. A polished dark theme
4. Code syntax highlighting
5. Responsive tables
6. Custom style variants

**Get started now!**
